20101228013116.000|20101228013118.000|CC1|FOR WATCHING.                   
20101228013118.000|20101228013119.000|CC1|SUSIE GHARIB IS OFF TONIGHT,    
20101228013119.000|20101228013120.000|CC1|AND SHE'S MISSING OUT ON AN     
20101228013120.000|20101228013122.000|CC1|HISTORIC STORM IN THE EASTERN   
20101228013122.000|20101228013123.000|CC1|SECTION OF THE COUNTRY.         
20101228013123.000|20101228013124.000|CC1|SNOW, SNOW AND MORE SNOW.       
20101228013124.000|20101228013126.000|CC1|THE MASSIVE STORM STRANDED      
20101228013126.000|20101228013128.000|CC1|TRAVELERS, CLOSED ROADS AND MADE
20101228013128.000|20101228013130.000|CC1|IT IMPOSSIBLE FOR PEOPLE TO GET 
20101228013130.000|20101228013132.000|CC1|TO WORK-- OR THE MALL.          
20101228013132.000|20101228013133.000|CC1|ALL THREE NEW YORK CITY-AREA    
20101228013133.000|20101228013134.000|CC1|AIRPORTS HAVE BEEN CLOSED ALL   
20101228013134.000|20101228013142.000|CC1|DAY.                            
20101228013142.000|20101228013143.000|CC1|JUST NOW STARTING TO REOPEN.    
20101228013143.000|20101228013144.000|CC1|NEARLY 1,000 FLIGHTS THERE WERE 
20101228013144.000|20101228013145.000|CC1|CANCELLED TODAY, AND PASSENGERS 
20101228013145.000|20101228013145.000|CC1|ARE EXPECTED TO BE STRANDED FOR 
20101228013145.000|20101228013146.000|CC1|DAYS.                           
20101228013146.000|20101228013146.000|CC1|ONE AIRLINE ANALYST PREDICTS THE
20101228013146.000|20101228013147.000|CC1|STORM AND ITS AFTERMATH COULD   
20101228013147.000|20101228013148.000|CC1|END UP COSTING THE AIRLINES     
20101228013148.000|20101228013151.000|CC1|ALONE AS MUCH AS $100 MILLION.  
20101228013151.000|20101228013153.000|CC1|30 INCHES OF SNOW HAS FALLEN IN 
20101228013153.000|20101228013156.000|CC1|SOME PLACES, AND FOR ALREADY    
20101228013156.000|20101228013157.000|CC1|CASH-STRAPPED MUNICIPALITIES    
20101228013157.000|20101228013158.000|CC1|THIS STORM IS BAD NEWS.         
20101228013158.000|20101228013200.000|CC1|IN NEW YORK CITY, FOR EXAMPLE,  
20101228013200.000|20101228013201.000|CC1|STORM CLEANUP GENERALLY COSTS   
20101228013201.000|20101228013202.000|CC1|THE CITY $1 MILLION PER INCH OF 
20101228013202.000|20101228013205.000|CC1|SNOW.                           
20101228013205.000|20101228013206.000|CC1|BUT, THE STORM HAS BEEN GOOD    
20101228013206.000|20101228013210.000|CC1|NEWS FOR ANYONE SELLING SHOVELS,
20101228013210.000|20101228013211.000|CC1|SNOW BLOWERS, OR ANYTHING TO    
20101228013211.000|20101228013213.000|CC1|REMOVE THE PILES OF SNOW.       
20101228013213.000|20101228013217.000|CC1|SHARES OF HOME DEPOT, TORO AND  
20101228013217.000|20101228013218.000|CC1|SNOW MOBILE MAKER POLARIS ALL   
20101228013218.000|20101228013221.000|CC1|MOVED HIGHER TODAY.             
20101228013221.000|20101228013222.000|CC1|STILL, ALL THAT SNOW ON THE     
20101228013222.000|20101228013223.000|CC1|GROUND IS BAD NEWS FOR RETAILERS
20101228013223.000|20101228013223.000|CC1|IN NORTHEAST.                   
20101228013223.000|20101228013224.000|CC1|IT COMES AT THE END OF A VERY   
20101228013224.000|20101228013225.000|CC1|BUSY HOLIDAY SHOPPING SEASON    
20101228013225.000|20101228013228.000|CC1|OVERALL.                        
20101228013228.000|20101228013229.000|CC1|AS ERIKA MILLER EXPLAINS, FOR   
20101228013229.000|20101228013231.000|CC1|MANY, IT ENDED UP BEING A GREEN 
20101228013231.000|20101228013234.000|CC1|CHRISTMAS AFTER ALL.            
20101228013234.000|20101228013235.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THIS WAS THE BEST  
20101228013235.000|20101228013237.000|CC1|WAY TO GET AROUND NEW YORK CITY 
20101228013237.000|20101228013238.000|CC1|TODAY.                          
20101228013238.000|20101228013240.000|CC1|SO IT'S NO SURPRISE MANY STORES 
20101228013240.000|20101228013241.000|CC1|IN THE NORTHEAST OPENED LATE, OR
20101228013241.000|20101228013243.000|CC1|DIDN'T OPEN AT ALL.             
20101228013243.000|20101228013245.000|CC1|UNFORTUNATELY FOR MANY          
20101228013245.000|20101228013246.000|CC1|MERCHANTS, THE STORM CAME AT A  
20101228013246.000|20101228013248.000|CC1|CRUCIAL PERIOD.                 
20101228013248.000|20101228013250.000|CC1|ON AVERAGE, STORES RING UP 10%  
20101228013250.000|20101228013251.000|CC1|TO 15% OF HOLIDAY SALES IN THE  
20101228013251.000|20101228013252.000|CC1|WEEK BETWEEN CHRISTMAS AND NEW  
20101228013252.000|20101228013258.000|CC1|YEAR'S.                         
20101228013258.000|20101228013259.000|CC1|BUT SCOTT KRUGMAN OF THE        
20101228013259.000|20101228013300.000|CC1|NATIONAL RETAIL FEDERATION      
20101228013300.000|20101228013301.000|CC1|POINTS OUT SOME WILL ACTUALLY   
20101228013301.000|20101228013301.000|CC1|BENEFIT FROM THE BLIZZARD.      
20101228013301.000|20101228013302.000|CC1|>> CLEARLY THE ONLINE SECTOR IS 
20101228013302.000|20101228013303.000|CC1|SHOWING A LOT OF STRENGTH.      
20101228013303.000|20101228013308.000|CC1|AND ANY TIME HARSH SEASONAL     
20101228013308.000|20101228013310.000|CC1|WEATHER, THE INTERNET BECOMES A 
20101228013310.000|20101228013311.000|CC1|PERFECT OUTLET FOR ANYONE WHO   
20101228013311.000|20101228013312.000|CC1|CAN'T GET TO THE MALLS.         
20101228013312.000|20101228013313.000|CC1|>> Reporter: BUT FOR MALL       
20101228013313.000|20101228013315.000|CC1|RETAILERS, THE STORM WILL MEAN A
20101228013315.000|20101228013316.000|CC1|DELAY IN GIFT CARD REDEMPTIONS. 
20101228013316.000|20101228013318.000|CC1|THOSE SALES AREN'T COUNTED UNTIL
20101228013318.000|20101228013320.000|CC1|THE CARDS ARE ACTUALLY SWIPED.  
20101228013320.000|20101228013325.000|CC1|ON TOP OF THAT, CONSUMERS WHO   
20101228013325.000|20101228013326.000|CC1|REDEEM GIFT CARDS TYPICALLY     
20101228013326.000|20101228013327.000|CC1|SPEND AN EXTRA 25% MORE THAN    
20101228013327.000|20101228013327.000|CC1|THEIR VALUE.                    
20101228013327.000|20101228013328.000|CC1|THE GOOD NEWS IS THE STORM CAME 
20101228013328.000|20101228013331.000|CC1|AFTER CHRISTMAS, NOT BEFORE.    
20101228013331.000|20101228013332.000|CC1|IN ADDITION, EXPERTS SAY SALES  
20101228013332.000|20101228013333.000|CC1|MOMENTUM WAS STRONG UP THROUGH  
20101228013333.000|20101228013336.000|CC1|CHRISTMAS EVE.                  
20101228013336.000|20101228013337.000|CC1|ALL TOLD, RETAILERS ARE EXPECTED
20101228013337.000|20101228013340.000|CC1|TO RING UP HOLIDAY SALES GAINS  
20101228013340.000|20101228013340.000|CC1|OF 3% TO 5%, POTENTIALLY THE    
20101228013340.000|20101228013344.000|CC1|BEST RESULTS SINCE 2006.        
20101228013344.000|20101228013346.000|CC1|BUT ANALYST DANA TELSEY SAYS    
20101228013346.000|20101228013347.000|CC1|THERE ARE SOME STANDOUTS.       
20101228013347.000|20101228013348.000|CC1|>> WE THINK THE BIG WINNERS WERE
20101228013348.000|20101228013350.000|CC1|DEFINITELY LUXURY GOODS.        
20101228013350.000|20101228013351.000|CC1|WE SAW ALL ACROSS THE COUNTRY   
20101228013351.000|20101228013352.000|CC1|LINES AT MANY OF THE JEWELRY    
20101228013352.000|20101228013354.000|CC1|STORES.                         
20101228013354.000|20101228013355.000|CC1|LUXURY GOODS WERE SELLING AT    
20101228013355.000|20101228013356.000|CC1|FULL PRICE AND THEY WERE RUNNING
20101228013356.000|20101228013358.000|CC1|OUT OF ITEMS.                   
20101228013358.000|20101228013359.000|CC1|JEWELRY WORKED.                 
20101228013359.000|20101228013400.000|CC1|APPAREL AND ACCESSORIES WORKED. 
20101228013400.000|20101228013400.000|CC1|AND CERTAINLY THE iPAD AND THE  
20101228013400.000|20101228013403.000|CC1|KINDLE WORKED.                  
20101228013403.000|20101228013404.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SHE HOPES THE      
20101228013404.000|20101228013405.000|CC1|EXTENSION OF THE BUSH TAX CUTS  
20101228013405.000|20101228013405.000|CC1|WILL ENCOURAGE CONSUMERS TO KEEP
20101228013405.000|20101228013409.000|CC1|SPENDING IN THE NEW YEAR.       
20101228013409.000|20101228013410.000|CC1|BUT OTHERS WORRY THE MOMENTUM

20101228013553.000|20101228013600.000|CC1|TO ALMOST $14 TRILLION.

20101228013618.000|20101228013618.000|CC1|JOBS FIRST.                     
20101228013618.000|20101228013619.000|CC1|IS THE FEDERAL RESERVE STRATEGY 
20101228013619.000|20101228013621.000|CC1|OF LOW INTEREST RATES AND BUYING
20101228013621.000|20101228013622.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT BONDS THE RIGHT ONE  
20101228013622.000|20101228013624.000|CC1|TO CREATE JOB OPPORTUNITIES?    
20101228013624.000|20101228013625.000|CC1|>> I THINK NOT REALLY.          
20101228013625.000|20101228013627.000|CC1|I THINK IT WAS THE RIGHT ONE AT 
20101228013627.000|20101228013629.000|CC1|THE BEGINNING OF THE RECESSION. 
20101228013629.000|20101228013630.000|CC1|BUT RIGHT NOW THE PROBLEM IS    
20101228013630.000|20101228013633.000|CC1|MANY OF THE JOB LOSSES ARE IN   
20101228013633.000|20101228013634.000|CC1|AREAS LIKE CONSTRUCTION, WHICH  
20101228013634.000|20101228013636.000|CC1|AREN'T GOING TO COME BACK.      
20101228013636.000|20101228013637.000|CC1|WHAT WE REALLY NEED TO THINK    
20101228013637.000|20101228013639.000|CC1|ABOUT IS HOW TO GET PEOPLE WE   
20101228013639.000|20101228013641.000|CC1|USED TO BE IN THAT INDUSTRY BACK
20101228013641.000|20101228013642.000|CC1|INTO THE WORK FORCE.            
20101228013642.000|20101228013644.000|CC1|AND THE KINDS OF THINGS WE NEED 
20101228013644.000|20101228013645.000|CC1|TO THINK ABOUT ARE WORKER       
20101228013645.000|20101228013647.000|CC1|RETRAINING, RESKILLING, THOSE   
20101228013647.000|20101228013649.000|CC1|ARE THINGS THAT CAN'T BE DONE   
20101228013649.000|20101228013650.000|CC1|THROUGH JUST THE FED HOLDING    
20101228013650.000|20101228013651.000|CC1|INTEREST RATES DOWN.            
20101228013651.000|20101228013652.000|CC1|SO MY SENSE IS THE FED HAS      
20101228013652.000|20101228013654.000|CC1|PRETTY MUCH DONE WHAT IT COULD, 
20101228013654.000|20101228013655.000|CC1|AND WE HAVE TO THINK OF NEW WAYS
20101228013655.000|20101228013658.000|CC1|OF GETTING THE 9.5% UNEMPLOYED  
20101228013658.000|20101228013659.000|CC1|BACK TO WORK.                   
20101228013659.000|20101228013700.000|CC1|>> Tom: EVEN THOUGH THE FED HAS 
20101228013700.000|20101228013702.000|CC1|ONE OF ITS TWO MANDATES AS FULL 
20101228013702.000|20101228013704.000|CC1|EMPLOYMENT, ARE YOU SAYING THE  
20101228013704.000|20101228013706.000|CC1|FEDERAL RESERVE IN 2011 IS      
20101228013706.000|20101228013708.000|CC1|IMPOTENT WHEN IT COMES TO TRYING
20101228013708.000|20101228013709.000|CC1|TO LOWER THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE? 
20101228013709.000|20101228013712.000|CC1|>> I THINK THE FED CAN'T DO IT. 
20101228013712.000|20101228013713.000|CC1|CERTAINLY CAN'T DO IT ALONE.    
20101228013713.000|20101228013716.000|CC1|WHAT WE REALLY NEED IS TO THINK 
20101228013716.000|20101228013718.000|CC1|ABOUT OTHER WAYS, DIRECT

20101228015210.000|20101228015210.000|CC1|MOVED IT TO A DISCOUNT PRICING  
20101228015210.000|20101228015214.000|CC1|STRATEGY A FEW YEARS LATER.     
20101228015214.000|20101228015215.000|CC1|H&R BLOCK IS LOSING ONE OF ITS  
20101228015215.000|20101228015218.000|CC1|MOST PROFITABLE SERVICES.       
20101228015218.000|20101228015219.000|CC1|THE COMPANY WILL NOT BE MAKING  
20101228015219.000|20101228015221.000|CC1|WHAT ARE CALLED "REFUND         
20101228015221.000|20101228015222.000|CC1|ANTICIPATION LOANS" THIS TAX    
20101228015222.000|20101228015222.000|CC1|SEASON.                         
20101228015222.000|20101228015232.000|CC1|REGULATORS TOLD THE BANK THAT   
20101228015232.000|20101228015232.000|CC1|UNDERWRITES H&R BLOCK'S LOANS TO
20101228015232.000|20101228015233.000|CC1|STOP.                           
20101228015233.000|20101228015233.000|CC1|THOSE LOANS ARE CONTROVERSIAL,  
20101228015233.000|20101228015234.000|CC1|COMING WITH HIGH INTEREST RATES 
20101228015234.000|20101228015234.000|CC1|AND FEES.                       
20101228015234.000|20101228015235.000|CC1|ANALYSTS SAY CANCELING THE      
20101228015235.000|20101228015236.000|CC1|SERVICE COULD COST H&R BLOCK A  
20101228015236.000|20101228015236.000|CC1|BIG EARNINGS HIT, ESPECIALLY    
20101228015236.000|20101228015237.000|CC1|SINCE RIVAL TAX PREP FIRMS CAN  
20101228015237.000|20101228015318.000|CC1|STILL OFFER THOSE PRODUCTS.     
20101228015318.000|20101228015329.000|CC1|        EUU@               TETET
20101228015329.000|20101228015330.000|CC1|WE HEARD ONE TAKE EARLIER IN THE
20101228015330.000|20101228015341.000|CC1|PROGRAM ON TACKLING OUR NATION'S
20101228015341.000|20101228015342.000|CC1|UNEMPLOYMENT, WHAT ABOUT DEBT   
20101228015342.000|20101228015342.000|CC1|LOAD?.                          
20101228015342.000|20101228015343.000|CC1|IT'S CLOSING IN ON $14 TRILLION.
20101228015343.000|20101228015343.000|CC1|TONIGHT'S COMMENTATOR IS        
20101228015343.000|20101228015344.000|CC1|CONVINCED WE CAN GET A HANDLE ON
20101228015344.000|20101228015344.000|CC1|ALL THOSE I.O.U.s.              
20101228015344.000|20101228015345.000|CC1|HE'S MARK ZANDI, CHIEF ECONOMIST
20101228015345.000|20101228015346.000|CC1|AT MOODY'S ANALYTICS.           
20101228015346.000|20101228015348.000|CC1|>> OF ALL OUR NATION'S ECONOMIC 
20101228015348.000|20101228015349.000|CC1|WORRIES, NONE ARE SCARIER THAN  
20101228015349.000|20101228015350.000|CC1|THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT'S RECORD 
20101228015350.000|20101228015351.000|CC1|BUDGET DEFICITS AND MOUNTING    
20101228015351.000|20101228015353.000|CC1|DEBT LOAD.                      
20101228015353.000|20101228015354.000|CC1|UNLESS WE MAKE BIG CHANGES SOON,
20101228015354.000|20101228015355.000|CC1|OUR ECONOMIC PAIN AND SUFFERING 
20101228015355.000|20101228015359.000|CC1|WILL GET WORSE, MUCH WORSE.     
20101228015359.000|20101228015400.000|CC1|I'M OPTIMISTIC WE WILL MAKE     
20101228015400.000|20101228015401.000|CC1|THOSE CHANGES.                  
20101228015401.000|20101228015402.000|CC1|PARTICULARLY ENCOURAGING IS THE 
20101228015402.000|20101228015404.000|CC1|INTELLECTUAL CONSENSUS FORMING  
20101228015404.000|20101228015406.000|CC1|ON HOW TO DO THIS.              
20101228015406.000|20101228015408.000|CC1|CONSIDER THE RECENT PROPOSALS   
20101228015408.000|20101228015409.000|CC1|FROM TWO DIFFERENT BIPARTISAN   
20101228015409.000|20101228015410.000|CC1|COMMISSIONS FORMED TO TACKLE    
20101228015410.000|20101228015411.000|CC1|THESE BUDGET ISSUES.            
20101228015411.000|20101228015412.000|CC1|WHILE THE PROPOSALS WILL NOT    
20101228015412.000|20101228015413.000|CC1|BECOME LAW, THEY LAY DOWN       
20101228015413.000|20101228015415.000|CC1|IMPORTANT BENCHMARKS AND        
20101228015415.000|20101228015416.000|CC1|ESTABLISH THE BASIS FOR A       
20101228015416.000|20101228015417.000|CC1|HEALTHY DEBATE.                 
20101228015417.000|20101228015419.000|CC1|THE KEY POINT OF AGREEMENT IS   
20101228015419.000|20101228015420.000|CC1|THAT BOTH GOVERNMENT SPENDING   
20101228015420.000|20101228015422.000|CC1|CUTS AND TAX INCREASES ARE      
20101228015422.000|20101228015424.000|CC1|NECESSARY.                      
20101228015424.000|20101228015425.000|CC1|AS IMPORTANT, THERE IS AGREEMENT
20101228015425.000|20101228015426.000|CC1|THAT THE FOCUS SHOULD BE ON     
20101228015426.000|20101228015428.000|CC1|SPENDING RESTRAINT.             
20101228015428.000|20101228015429.000|CC1|AN EXAMINATION OF OTHER PERIODS 
20101228015429.000|20101228015431.000|CC1|OF FISCAL AUSTERITY HERE AND    
20101228015431.000|20101228015432.000|CC1|ABROAD SUGGESTS THAT ADJUSTING  
20101228015432.000|20101228015434.000|CC1|SPENDING IS BETTER FOR AN       
20101228015434.000|20101228015435.000|CC1|ECONOMY THAN RAISING TAXES AS A 
20101228015435.000|20101228015438.000|CC1|MEANS OF REDUCING DEFICITS.     
20101228015438.000|20101228015439.000|CC1|WITH REGARD TO TAXES, THE       
20101228015439.000|20101228015441.000|CC1|PROPOSALS SCALE BACK THE        
20101228015441.000|20101228015442.000|CC1|LOOPHOLES THAT RIDDLE THE TAX   
20101228015442.000|20101228015443.000|CC1|CODE.                           
20101228015443.000|20101228015444.000|CC1|AND THE CORPORATE TAX CODE IS   
20101228015444.000|20101228015445.000|CC1|MADE MORE COMPETITIVE.          
20101228015445.000|20101228015446.000|CC1|ON SPENDING, SOCIAL SECURITY IS 
20101228015446.000|20101228015448.000|CC1|NUDGED FROM AN ENTITLEMENT TO AN
20101228015448.000|20101228015449.000|CC1|INSURANCE POLICY.               
20101228015449.000|20101228015450.000|CC1|THAT IS, PEOPLE WOULD RECEIVE   
20101228015450.000|20101228015452.000|CC1|BENEFITS AS THEY ARE NEEDED.    
20101228015452.000|20101228015453.000|CC1|AND GOVERNMENT HEALTH CARE      
20101228015453.000|20101228015454.000|CC1|SPENDING IS GIVEN A CLEAR       
20101228015454.000|20101228015456.000|CC1|BUDGET.                         
20101228015456.000|20101228015457.000|CC1|GLOBAL INVESTORS STILL HAVE     
20101228015457.000|20101228015459.000|CC1|FAITH IN AMERICA-- LOOK AT OUR  
20101228015459.000|20101228015501.000|CC1|LOW INTEREST RATES, AND THE FACT
20101228015501.000|20101228015502.000|CC1|THAT INVESTORS STILL RUN FOR    
20101228015502.000|20101228015502.000|CC1|SAFETY IN U.S. TREASURY BONDS
